speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: SCENE V. The same. A street.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Enter SPEED and LAUNCE severally

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Launce! by mine honesty, welcome to Milan!

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: Forswear not thyself, sweet youth, for I am not

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: welcome. I reckon this always, that a man is never

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: undone till he be hanged, nor never welcome to a

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: place till some certain shot be paid and the hostess

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: say 'Welcome!'

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Come on, you madcap, I'll to the alehouse with you

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: presently; where, for one shot of five pence, thou

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: shalt have five thousand welcomes. But, sirrah, how

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: did thy master part with Madam Julia?

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: Marry, after they closed in earnest, they parted very

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: fairly in jest.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: But shall she marry him?

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: No.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: How then? shall he marry her?

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: No, neither.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: What, are they broken?

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: No, they are both as whole as a fish.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Why, then, how stands the matter with them?

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: Marry, thus: when it stands well with him, it

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: stands well with her.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: What an ass art thou! I understand thee not.

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: What a block art thou, that thou canst not! My

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: staff understands me.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: What thou sayest?

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: Ay, and what I do too: look thee, I'll but lean,

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: and my staff understands me.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: It stands under thee, indeed.

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: Why, stand-under and under-stand is all one.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: But tell me true, will't be a match?

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: Ask my dog: if he say ay, it will! if he say no,

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: it will; if he shake his tail and say nothing, it will.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: The conclusion is then that it will.

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: Thou shalt never get such a secret from me but by a parable.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: 'Tis well that I get it so. But, Launce, how sayest

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: thou, that my master is become a notable lover?

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: I never knew him otherwise.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Than how?

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: A notable lubber, as thou reportest him to be.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Why, thou whoreson ass, thou mistakest me.

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: Why, fool, I meant not thee; I meant thy master.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: I tell thee, my master is become a hot lover.

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: Why, I tell thee, I care not though he burn himself

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: in love. If thou wilt, go with me to the alehouse;

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: if not, thou art an Hebrew, a Jew, and not worth the

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: name of a Christian.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Why?

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: Because thou hast not so much charity in thee as to

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: go to the ale with a Christian. Wilt thou go?

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: At thy service.

speaker: SPEED
text_entry: Exeunt
